Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.cards.playable

Class PlayableCard.Builder<T extends PlayableCard>

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.cards.playable.PlayableCard.Builder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The specific type of PlayableCard that this Builder builds.
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard.Builder, ResourceCard.Builder
Enclosing class:
PlayableCard
public abstract static class PlayableCard.Builder<T extends PlayableCard> extends Object
This is an abstract Builder class for creating instances of PlayableCard.

The Builder follows the "Builder" design pattern. It provides a way to construct a complex object step by step. This Builder is abstract and is meant to be subclassed by concrete Builder classes for specific types of PlayableCard.

The Builder takes the id, points, and primary color of the PlayableCard as parameters in its constructor. These values are then used to set the corresponding fields of the PlayableCard when the build method is called.

The build method is abstract and must be implemented by subclasses of this Builder. It is responsible for creating the PlayableCard and ensuring that it is in a valid state.

The type parameter T extends PlayableCard, meaning the Builder can be used to create any type of PlayableCard.

  • Constructor Details

    • Builder

      protected Builder (int id, int cardPoints, @NotNull @NotNull GameColor primaryColor) throws IllegalCardBuildException
      The constructor for PlayableCard.Builder it sets as final its color, points and id.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the card unique from others
      cardPoints - Points value of the card to create
      primaryColor - Color of the card to create
      Throws:
      IllegalCardBuildException - if cardPoints are negative

  • Method Details

    • hasIn

      public abstract PlayableCard.Builder<T> hasIn (@NotNull @NotNull Corner corner, @NotNull @NotNull CornerContainer cornerContainer) throws IllegalCardBuildException
      Specifies the item to be placed in a given corner of the PlayableCard being built.

      This method is abstract and must be implemented by subclasses of Builder.

      If the specified corner can’t contain the provided item, the method throws an IllegalCardBuildException.

      Parameters:
      corner - The corner where the item should be placed.
      cornerContainer - The item to be placed in the specified corner.
      Returns:
      The Builder instance, allowing for method chaining.
      Throws:
      IllegalCardBuildException - if the item can’t be placed in the specified corner.

    • build

      public abstract T build() throws IllegalCardBuildException
      Constructs a new instance of a subclass of PlayableCard using the parameters set by the builder's methods.

      The method uses the parameters set by the builder's methods to construct the PlayableCard. These parameters include the color, points, id, and any items placed in the corners of the PlayableCard.

      If the build is incomplete or impossible (for example, if an item is placed in a corner that can’t contain it), the method throws an IllegalCardBuildException.

      Returns:
      A fully constructed instance of a subclass of PlayableCard
      Throws:
      IllegalCardBuildException - if the build is incomplete or impossible
